meanings.definition: Representing a perfect example of a particular quality or type.
meanings.sent1: The small, shiny trophy was epitomic of her hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent2: Her elegant dress was epitomic of her sophisticated style.
meanings.sent3: The epitomic cake was so delicious that it disappeared within minutes.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in epitomic hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree stood epitomic against the backdrop of the clear blue sky.

meanings.definition: A summary or condensed version of something.
meanings.sent1: The student prepared an epitomic of the lengthy research paper for her presentation.
meanings.sent2: The brochure provided an epitomic of the main attractions in the city.
meanings.sent3: The epitomic of the novel was so brief that it left out all the exciting parts.
meanings.sent4: The recipe book contained an epitomic of easy-to-make dishes for beginners.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed an epitomic of ancient artifacts from different civilizations.
